intro: Secamone ankarensis, commonly known as the African moonseed, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Menispermaceae and is characterized by its climbing habit and compound leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are followed by distinctive, elongated, fleshy fruits. Its roots and leaves have been traditionally used in herbal medicine for their purported medicinal properties. The botanical features of Secamone ankarensis make it an important species in both ecological and pharmacological contexts.
